author: anmenaga
body:
## PR Summary

Currently installation instructions mention specifying full path to "pwsh".
It would be handy to have a symlink so that PowerShell could be run without specifying full path.

Fixes #6121

comments.author: SwarfegaGit
comments.body:
This works for me but I have to logout and back in for it to work?
Also my Pi2 takes around 20 seconds to process the command (opening pwsh takes it out of the poor thing).  Wouldn't it be better to do it outside of PowerShell which takes <1ms?

    sudo ln -s ~/powershell/pwsh /usr/bin/pwsh

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
@SwarfegaGit few points:
1) no logout required; Once symlink is created it can be used immediately. Or am I missing your point?
2) PowerShell currently isn't supposed to run on Pi2 (.NET Core limitation on CPU architecture). Are you sure yours is not Pi3?
3) thank you for "ln" example - I'll include it as comment.

comments.author: SwarfegaGit
comments.body:
@anmenaga the Pi2 and Pi3 work.  It's the Pi 1 and Zero that doesn't work... sadly.
The first time I tried this it didn't work.  The symbolic link was created but it just didn't work until after I had logged out and back in.  Maybe it was me but I would need to test again.

comments.author: anmenaga
comments.body:
@SwarfegaGit you are right P2 is supported; I've confused it previously with the other one.
By the way, is your Pi2 ver 1.2 ? Can you please run "uname -a" on it and post output here? Thanks.
